property.name: text
property.value: Authors: Chihhong Patrick Cheng, Edward A. Lee, Christopher Brooks

property.name: modelType
property.value: Communicating Timed Automata (Acceptable by RED under DE)

property.name: text
property.value:
General Model Description: This model describes existing features for Ptolemy II to perform model-checking by translating the DE model to communicating timed automata.
In this model, there are three real-time actors. The clock has the period with value 6. In this setting, the signal (alternating between 0 and 1) occurs with the period of 3. Two TimedDelay actors specify the fixed delay of the system.
The behavior of the PedestrianLight should be noted. Although the first transition has the guard "true", as shown in the plotter it will not be activated until time approaching 10. This is because the FSMActor always listens to its input port.

property.name: text
text
property.value:
Execution & Results: For model checking, please download the model checker RED 7.0 from http://sourceforge.net/projects/redlib. Assume your converted file is TEST.d, and your generated specification is TEST.risk, with RED 7.0 installed, you may examine the result of verification by the following instruction: "./red -Tr -C TEST.d TEST.risk" Timed required for result generation may vary from 1 sec to 10 secs.
Interestingly, since the rate of the clock is slower than the worst case transmission time of Pgo and Pstop, the model guarantees the behavior of safety (both lights will not be green simultaneously). If you change the timing parameters (e.g., clock = 4 [offsets = 2.0; if you don't set this, results from simulation and verification differ], timedDelay = 1, timedDelay = 5), a counter-example will be shown.

property.name: text
property.value: Remark: For the TimedDelay actor, the delay is fixed. This model can thus be simplified using SR modeling with counters. The power of timed automata and related theories lie in the modeling and the verification of "reals". In Ptolemy II, you can find the actor "BoundedBufferNondeterministicDelay" from "More Libraries -- Code Generators -- Verification". Note that the semantic of this actor is that it will fire the event in the time strictly smaller than the user-specified value, which is much useful for the design and analysis of embedded systems. Unfortunately, currently these actors can not be executed under simulation mode.

property.name: description
property.value: To edit the documentation that appears when the user double clicks on this icon, right click on the _background_ of the model and select Documentation->Customize Documentation. The description you are currently editing will not appear when the user double clicks on the Documentation icon.
